body:
You are talking about squashfs files I think.

We have an in development backend for that

[v1.71.0-beta.8811.7b2f77933.archive-backend](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/archive-backend/v1.71.0-beta.8811.7b2f77933.archive-backend/) on branch [archive-backend](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/archive-backend) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Use it like this `:archive:remote:path/to/dir/or/archive/file`

It supports zip files ans squahfs archives.
Cool. Not squash zstd I presume? It's newish. And you can run in rootless android right?

issue.title: Can rsaf 'mount' a local or remote squashfs file?

repository.name: RSAF
repository.description: An Android Storage Access Framework document provider for rclone

issue.body:
I know, I know, rooting solves it, but I can't root this device, and I thought, hey, rsaf already does a sort of mount system using SAF and supports a lot of remote filesystems and some local ones, and rclone is supposed to be able to mount squash files, so I might as well ask. 

Fucking google. 

edit: also I wonder if I would be able to 'mount' a squash file in android 10 (which is my tablet) because the readme says that it only asks for the permission to access the sdcard in android 11+...

body:
> Cool. Not squash zstd I presume?

Not at the moment. It wouldn't be difficult to add if there is a pure go implementation.

> And you can run in rootless android right?

Sure. It doesn't use any OS facilities for decoding squashfs files.

just from searching in Google there is this (and the linked lib for seekable streams), unsure of quality ofc. 

https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/klauspost/compress/zstd#section-readme 

https://github.com/SaveTheRbtz/zstd-seekable-format-go

I was using zstd, but ofc I can use something else like lz4 or xz, whichever is implemented.

Anything klauspost produces will be excellent :-) A seekable variant isn't necessary as squashfs compresses in blocks anyway.

The package supports lz4 and xz as is.

Any news about this? No movement in the branch for 1.5 months or PR to main, make a bit anxious. If I could, I'd use a build from the branch ofc, but I want this specifically for RSAF, a android application, and I have no way to build it, since ironically, I'm using a android phone, so my plan was just to wait for this to get merged to use it the next time RSAF updates (it updates whenever rclone does a minor release).

3 months later ;)

I wouldn't mind waiting more if the reason is the open PR to add zstd reading and writing in project https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/8756
I'm planning to merge this for v1.72 :-)
I hope it works with squash zstd too üôè

> I hope it works with squash zstd too üôè

It does!

A small simple question before I wait for this to be closed as completed.

You mentioned I only need to configure it with ":archive:remote:path/to/dir/or/archive/file", does that mean that for a sqfs file stored locally do I need:

:archive:192.168.1.1:path/to/dir/or/archive/file or :archive:localhost:path/to/dir/or/archive/file or :archive::path/to/dir/or/archive/file ? 

edit: on second though maybe this is a better question for rsaf when rclone 1.7.2 is released, which is the app that I want to use this functionality on, since it will ask me what it needs in the format necessary later and asking now is pointless because I can't use it directly and provide the files to other android apps without rsaf.

> A small simple question before I wait for this to be closed as completed.
> 
> You mentioned I only need to configure it with ":archive:remote:path/to/dir/or/archive/file", does that mean that for a sqfs file stored locally do I need:
> 
> :archive:192.168.1.1:path/to/dir/or/archive/file or :archive:localhost:path/to/dir/or/archive/file or :archive::path/to/dir/or/archive/file ?

The final one `:archive::path/to/dir/or/archive/file`
